svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - October 4 2020

title: "Week in Eth News
October 4, 2020" date: "2020-10-04"
Eth News and Links
Eth1
• Geth v1.9.22 , bug fixes and a flag to override max gas price
• Weekly Turbogeth alpha . Much faster logs using roaring bitmaps. Using the Turbogeth API, a UI to
find eth supply at any block
• Using the Turbogeth API, a UI to find eth supply at any block
• Latest core devs call . Tim Beiko’s notes
• Transactions overhaul overview doc
• block header sync in light clients
EIPs/Standards
• 3009 : Transfer With Authorization
• 3014 : Create eth_symbol method for JSON-RPC
Proof of Stake launch
• Latest what’s new in eth2 , the 2 year anniversary issue “I believe the deposit contract deployment
to be days, not weeks, away.”
• “I believe the deposit contract deployment to be days, not weeks, away.”
• eth2 quick update Spadina showed we need better client diversity , so another dress rehearsal named
Zinken
• Spadina showed we need better client diversity , so another dress rehearsal named Zinken
• Eth2 client benchmarks
• SigmaPrime fuzzing found some slashing vulnerabilities and 2 bugs in blst library
• Latest eth2 call . Notes from Ben and Mamy
• Attack via time servers and mitigation
• Attestant wrote their own validator client so they can switch between eth2 nodes
• secret shared validator PoC
• If you’re running in the cloud (not advised!), check out Kotal (switch clients and/or cloud
providers easily) or 1 line helm/kubernetes cluster command to switch between Nimbus/Lighthouse
• Pintail has the first entry I’ve seen to the Medalla data challenge
Layer2
• Rollups as “ fast pipes and smart VMs ”
• Barry Whitehat on sidechains vs layer2 . Echos of Georgios’ “sidechains are not layer2” tweetstorm
• Easy way to run a Raiden node
• The story of how Geohot helped fix Optimism’s transpiler
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Trail of Bits!
Get immediate security help by booking an office hours session with Trail of Bits. In a 1 hour, 1-on-1
working session with an engineer from Trail of Bits, get help with your top security challenges and
expert guidance to inform your approach.
Stuff for developers
• Solidity v0.7.2 - bugfix for free functions; adds compiler-generated utility file export. Expanded
SMTChecker.
• Jolly Roger : wighawag’s Eth app with PWA frontend template
• Damnvulnerabledefi.xyz : practice finding security holes
• Solidity bytes library had a bug in the slice method, please update
• Testing with waffle v3
• Solidity railroad grammar
• abi to sol: generate Solidity interface from ABI
• ethers-rs now has rust implementation of secp256k1
• NPM package to deploy to same address on EVM chains
• Coding a leaderboard tutorial in Solidity
• Breaking Eth nodes with TeaTime ; 34 RPC scans
• How EMN got hacked this week using a flashloan
• Sam Sun finds bug on Incognito’s bridge
Ecosystem
• A rollup-centric Ethereum roadmap . Vitalik argues that we should make some rollup-friendly changes
to mainnet; launch sharding for data availability for rollups (phase 1), then swap out proof of work
for proof of stake. This is all happening soon™, whereas phase2 is not close (and maybe not
necessary?)
• It’s been clear for awhile that this was Eth’s roadmap: eth2 is a rollup
• In September, miners made more from fees than block rewards
• An update on Waku v2 messaging , moving to libp2p, better routing, more nodes
• Devcon Bogotá: August 10-13, 2021
Enterprise
• EY Opschain Network Procurement : e2e private enterprise procurement on mainnet using Baseline
Protocol
• SEC Chairman Clayton says all stocks could become tokenized
Application layer
• Uniswap’s volume exceeds Coinbase for the month of September
• Andre Cronje deployed some test code for a game from an address known to be his, and 15 million
flooded in before a hacker found a bug and sent half back. Link in devs section for hack details.
• Augur: foundry.finance to easily provide liquidity to whether Trump will win, and a Uniswap-like
interface for end users to predict Trump or Biden
• Aggregator wars: Matcha claims it has the best prices , adjusted for transaction fees
• RAC’s $TAPE is the most expensive cassette of all time . He’s also giving out $RAC to his supporters
• DefiSaver adds Aave liquidation protection
• A new round of Dark Forest is live . Now spawn to safe spaces; uses burner wallets.
• Shield mining : any token can incentivize Nexus Mutual staking so that there is more Nexus Mutual
coverage for their project
Regulation (“end of agency fiscal year” issue)
• SDNY judge rules against Kin in summary judgment (legal term for “Kin loses; not even close”)
• SEC forces Salt to repay investors from q2 2017 sale
• Bitmex charged by DOJ and CFTC for money laundering and unlawful operation of an exchange
• Americans are de facto no longer allowed to pay ransomware
• Venezuelan dictatorship attempts Eth-based dex to circumvent US sanctions
Business/tokens
• Wax announces Eth bridge: “ Ethereum is best positioned to become the monetary system for all
blockchains ”
• Arjun Balaji: crypto market structure 3.0
• Moats in crypto
• The bull case for social tokens
• Danger Zhang: defi forks have been value acretive
• A liquidity mining taxonomy
General
• Stark-based VDFs
• Brave is at 20m monthly active users
• Life after losing crypto , a practical guide
• To help avoid losing crypto, learn how to read audit reports
Job Listings
• Livepeer is hiring a Blockchain Community Marketing + Ops Lead
• BnkToTheFuture is hiring a high performance dev team! Come create the future !
• Collaborate with Chainlink’s incredible ecosystem as a Marketing Director
• Trail of Bits hiring elite blockchain security engineers & app security
• DeFi devs! Yield is hiring for Solidity and front-end – contact@yield.is
• 0x is hiring devs! Full-stack, back-end, front-end or Solidity
• Celer Network: hiring Solidity and Go devs. Email: hiring@celer.network
• Nexus Mutual: experienced Solidity dev ; prefer European timezones
Want your job listing here ? $250 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH (or
250 DAI or 250 USDC) to evan.ethereum.eth. Questions? thecryptonewspodcast at-gmail
🥩 Staking pool questionnaire: October 15 🥩
My questionnaire for staking pools will be due October 15th.
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum News ,” then please put it on
an Ethereum subreddit; emails/DMs are not part of my workflow.
Please click the following if you’re interested in sponsoring the newsletter
Follow the newsletter on twitter: @WeekinEthNews
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-eth-news-october-4-2020/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new/changes in bold ) :
• Oct 12 - Zinken eth2 dress rehearsal (deposits due by Oct 8)
• Oct 19-26 - EthLagos energy hackathon
• Oct 20 - submission deadline for Medalla data challenge
• Oct 31 - submission deadline for Underhanded Solidity Contest
• Nov 6-7 - virtual Trufflecon
• Nov 16 - MetaMask Provider breaking changes
Did you get forwarded this newsletter? Sign up to receive it weekly
